resources.string: Files are automatically renamed after the trigger occur.

string-array.name: service_type_labels
string-array.item: Camera events: pictures or videos taken.
Media content observer: pictures or videos saved.
File observer: watch on selected folders when files are added. You must check \"Rename within a folder\" and have a least one folder on \"Select a folder\".

resources.string: Set the application theme: light or dark.
The auto rename service is disabled.
The auto rename service is triggered by camera events.
The auto rename service is triggered by media content events.
The auto rename service is triggered when a file is added on selected folders. You must check \"Rename within a folder\" and have a least one folder on \"Select a folder\".
This option allow you to choose above delay units between seconds and minutes.
By checking this option, the video are automatically renamed too, default are renamed only pictures.
Normally the rename service will scan all files from your device, by enabling this option you can limit the rename service within a folder.
For Android Lollipop users, please enable this feature and chose folders where your camera application save files.

READ CAREFULLY:
Renamed and moved files process cannot be rolled back!
Use this software with caution!
Define file name patterns individually for pictures or clips, renamed files can be moved to another folder also. Wildcards * or ? can be used too.
Do not use too generics pattern like *.JPG to avoid infinite renaming looping.
Better use ? to define a single possible character in combination with other constant existing character like _.
For example if original file name are like 20150729_212537.JPG use a pattern like ????????_??????.JPG and put a prefix 'PIC_' (use the apostrophes to define constant texts) into the rename pattern like "'PIC_'yyyyMMdd_HHmmss" to rename the file to: PIC_20150729_212537.JPG

Because on Android KitKat are enabled some security constraints, this application will not be able to rename files from SD Card.
See the link http://goo.gl/kJeED3 for a possible fix.
This application can rename files from internal memory only.
Set your camera application to save on internal memory.
As an Android Lollipop user, you should enable \"Rename within a folder\" option and you should define at least one folder to be scanned on \"List of scanned folders.\".
Please take a look to option \"%1$s\" because was removed the default separator character _, you should put it manually which character you want in front of number format \"%2$s\".
At least one folder should be left unchecked!
Select at least one folder to delete!
Do you want to remove selected folders?

Your Android version do not have support to chose folders (ACTION_OPEN_DOCUMENT_TREE).\nDo you want to use internal folder picker to select a folder? Using internal folder picker the application will not have granted rights to rename and move files!

Your system revoked permissions for below folder:

%s

Check where this folder was defined and try to select it again!

You may ignore this message, but the application will not work properly till it's gain access over above folder.

Your system revoked permissions for below folders:

%s

Check where these folders were defined and try to select them again!

You may ignore this message, but the application will not work properly till it's gain access over above folders.

Normally this should NOT BE SELECTED! By selecting this option the rename service will scan for media files on the above selected folders. Select this if your device have media content scanner disabled.
The file name patterns used to search files for rename (\"DSC_*.JPG\" or \"MOV_*.MP4\"), e.g. %s\nWildcards * and ? can be used too.

Old file name example:
	 %1$s
Renamed file name example:
	 %2$s
Rename filename pattern cannot be empty.
Original pattern is too generic causing to rename files over and over again. Try to define a more restrictive pattern using ? and other used characters.
Original file name pattern already exist, change the text with a new one.
The original and rename pattern are matching!
The original pattern is matching with a rename pattern defined on other case!
The rename pattern is matching with an original pattern defined on other case!
This suffix is used when more than one file have same name, like in burst case. By default the counter have 5 digits.\nExample:\n%s
The file extension is preserved during rename process.
date and time when file was last time modified.
Move the renamed file to below selected folder.
No folder selected, touch this text to select a folder.

string-array.name: rename_file_using_labels
string-array.item: date and time when file was added to media provider;
date and time when file was last time modified;
EXIF for images and for clips use second choice.

resources.string: Keep and append original name, for example, from DSC_09.JPG the new name will be %s_DSC_09.JPG
Create on your home screen a DSC rename service shortcut to launch the rename service manually.
Remove from your home screen the DSC rename service shortcut
Show or not the confirmation dialog when the DSC rename service is launched from shortcut.
Do you want to start manually the rename service?
If selected file(s) are not on a selected folder then rename will not be completed due to Android security restrictions.\nDo you want to start manually the rename service?
Touch to start manually rename service
Touch to reset the number of renamed files.
Do you want to reset the renamed files counter?
At least one file name pattern should be left unchecked!
Select at least one file name pattern to delete!
Do you want to remove selected file name pattern?
File can not be read and write
The application should be restarted to be applied selected language.
Touch this option to request for required application permissions: Camera (used to receive the capture moment), Storage (used to rename and move files).
Do you want to request for required application permissions?
Send an e-mail with debugging files
Do you want to send a debugging report?\nYour default e-mail application will send an e-mail with two files attached, please fill a short description of your issues if is necessary.\nThank you!
Debugging logs for DSC Auto Rename
License details for open source software
Please make a donation if you appreciate this application.

If you appreciate this application, please do a donation buying DSC Auto Rename PRO!\nPressing YES button, you will be sent to DSC Auto Rename PRO from Google Play Store.\nThank you for using this application!
Thank you for the appreciation of my work, buying pro application.

string.name: about_text
string.Data:
Many thanks to Simon W for full support for 4.0.0 version development!
This application was made to automatically change the name of images files taken by the camera based on the date and time when the file was created.

The file rename format use Java date and time format parameters:
- yyyy for years;
- MM for month;
- dd for day;
- HH for hour;
- mm for minutes;
- ss for seconds;
- SSS for milliseconds.
Unfortunately due to EXIF specifications and Android file name date time the milliseconds are not used internally.
See more format information on: Java SimpleDateFormat class

If more files were generated on the same time, like on the burst case, the files will have a counting suffix like _01. Depending how many digits are defined on the settings.

Define file name patterns individually for pictures or clips. Wildcards * or ? can be used too.
Do not use too generics pattern like *.JPG to avoid infinite renaming looping.
Better use ? to define a single possible character in combination with other constant existing character like _.
For example if original file name are like 20150729_212537.JPG use a pattern like ????????_??????.JPG and put a prefix \'PIC_\' (use the apostrophes to define constant texts) into the rename pattern like \"\'PIC_\'yyyyMMdd_HHmmss\" to rename the file to: PIC_20150729_212537.JPG

The rename service, if is enabled, automatically is triggered when the image file is saved on the device media storage.

The trigger depends on the camera application used to take the pictures. The camera application must send com.android.camera.NEW_PICTURE or android.hardware.action.NEW_PICTURE, otherwise, the rename service is not triggered.
In some cases, the camera do not send any message, so is possible to select as a trigger the media content events, but this imply a permanently running service in background.

For more details, please see application description page on Google Play - DSC Auto Rename.
Thank you for translations to:
- Chawalit for Thai
- Runels for 4PDA for Russian
- Leo Manias for Portuguese (Brazil)
- Dave for Spanish
